{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3321699,"name":"","username":"Crafter","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/77aa72/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-01T21:25:06.893Z","cooked":"

Hey our PDH recently started giving random voltage drops to a 12v to 19v converter on our bot. Looking at the PDH in RHC shows an active hardware fault and a “CSA Channel Read” error. Unplugging the converter has done nothing. Any idea what could be causing this?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2024-03-01T21:25:06.893Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":634,"reads":223,"readers_count":222,"score":3214.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":456875,"topic_slug":"csa-channel-read-error","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55818,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/csa-channel-read-error/456875/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3321814,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-02T02:16:57.014Z","cooked":"

Random drops sounds like a bad connection, which could be a breaker connector issue or even an internal connection. Have you reached out to Rev support? Have you tried changing which channel the converter is plugged into?

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2024-03-02T02:18:19.660Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":19,"reads":208,"readers_count":207,"score":141.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":456875,"topic_slug":"csa-channel-read-error","display_username":"Peter Johnson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13575,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA"},"post_url":"/t/csa-channel-read-error/456875/2","custom_user_title":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3321906,"name":"Quinton Rodgers","username":"Quint0n53","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/q/b782af/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-02T03:43:26.446Z","cooked":"

We had an issue like this last year. We had the sticky faults on channels, which showed a CSA channel read error in Rev Hardware Client. Attached is our contact with Rev. TL;DR the CSA chip has no impact on the usability and therefore is safe to continue using.

image1475×624 167 KB

image1479×263 17 KB

image1484×195 11.9 KB

We contacted Rev as our Rio was disconnecting often, turns out this was not the issue but it was something else.
